pullRequest.body:
In ordinal/cardinal arithmetic, a normal function is a strictly monotonic continuous function. Unfortunately, defining normal functions like this would add hundreds of imports to the respective files, so we opt for a definition that's more lightweight often and more convenient: a normal function is a strictly monotonic function where, for a successor limit `a`, the value `f a` is the LUB of `f b` for `b < a`.

The predicate [`Ordinal.IsNormal`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/SetTheory/Ordinal/Arithmetic.html#Ordinal.IsNormal) already exists. This generalization serves two purposes:

1. We can now talk about normality of functions between ordinals and cardinals, rather than functions that are strictly between ordinals. Examples include [`Cardinal.ord`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/SetTheory/Ordinal/Basic.html#Cardinal.ord), [`Cardinal.aleph`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/SetTheory/Cardinal/Aleph.html#Cardinal.aleph), and [`Cardinal.beth`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/SetTheory/Cardinal/Aleph.html#Cardinal.beth).
2. This is also useful to my project on formalizing [ordinal notations](https://github.com/vihdzp/ordinal-notation), as I can now state that addition, multiplication, etc. defined on an ordinal notation are also normal functions.

A future PR will deprecate `Ordinal.IsNormal` in favor of this new predicate.

---

### PR summary [342de069f6](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20504/commits/342de069f6fa89eef6c48a0211c01df7966d2a58)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Order.Normal` (new file)|399|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsNormal`
`+ _root_.InitialSeg.isNormal`
`+ _root_.OrderIso.isNormal`
`+ _root_.PrincipalSeg.isNormal`
`+ id`
`+ id_le`
`+ inj`
`+ isLUB_image_Iio_of_isSuccLimit`
`+ le_apply`
`+ le_iff_forall_le`
`+ le_iff_le`
`+ lt_iff_exists_lt`
`+ lt_iff_lt`
`+ map_iSup`
`+ map_isLUB`
`+ map_sSup`
`+ of_succ_lt`
`+ trans`
`++ map_isSuccPrelimit`
`+++ map_isSuccLimit`
`++++ _`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20496~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20502~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20503~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

I find it bad to motivate such changes by import concerns. At least, we have to be very sure there's no way to tame the imports, eg here to reduce the imports to continuity until it's okay to import it in the theory of ordinal-valued functions.

Have you tried that?

There was a brief experiment to make ordinals import topology, and it added some hundred or so imports.

Some basic ordinal arithmetic is required to set up cardinal arithmetic, which are then needed in linear algebra, model theory, or even to some extent to characterize `Nat.card`. Adding even basic topology as an import to all of these things would be pretty catastrophic.

The characterization of ordinal functions as continuous and strictly monotone functions isn't even all too useful within ordinal arithmetic. For the most part, one really only cares about the fact that normal functions "commute" with suprema, i.e. `f (sSup s) = sSup (f '' s)`, which is what this definition takes as its characterization.

None of what you said seems to precisely contradict my point that you could reduce imports to continuity.

Can you at least bring it up on Zulip?

There was a brief discussion a few months ago:
https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/116395-maths/topic/Generalizing.20normal.20functions

pullRequest.title: feat: generalize normal functions
